div.p: Be INTENSE in MOVING OR CHANGING CAUSING the PERIOD of this MOVEMENT OR CHANGE to be INTENSELY SHORT.
1. The most current general word for anything that moves at high speed is sù 速 (ant. chí 遲 "so slowly that one becomes late").
2. Jí 疾 (ant. xú 徐 "slowly") typically refers to urgent speedy action of limited duration.
3. Jí 亟 (ant huǎn 緩 "too slowly") refers to maximum speed possible under prevailing circumstances.
4. Jíé 捷 adds to the notion of maximum speed the nuance of deftness and general skill.
5. Piāo 飄 refers specifically to the speed of wind.
6. Xùn 迅 emphasises high speed and abruptness and eruptive violence, often in natural processes.
7. Bù rì 不日 without delay, in a short time, quickly.
NB: Kuài 快 came to mean "quickly" soon after Han times.
麻利 (coll) refers to swift agility.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: 572. Ex Agraet. qui amplius, Velocitas pedum et corporum, celeritas animorum atque factorum.
citus refers to swift and lively movement.
celer refers to eager and swift intense movement.
rapidus refers to movement which is very eager to be as fast as possible.
velocitas refers to nimble dexterity in linear movement like running, swimming etc.
pernicitas refers to swiftness of movement in hopping, vauling, climbing etc.

bibl.title: Tolkovo-kombinatornyj slovar' sovremmenogo russkogo jazyka. Explanatory Combinatorial Dictionary of Modern Russian
Handbuch der lateinischen und griechischen Synonymik
東漢﹣隨常用詞演變研究
古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典

entry.def: Jí 亟 (ant. huǎn 緩 "too slowly") refers to maximum speed possible under prevailing circumstances.

sense.def: quickly, urgently, on the spot, without any delay whatsoever
HUAINAN: in no time, after short intervals; occasionally used verbally: dart forth abruptly
be quick and dramatic YANG XIONG 二世而亡，何其劇與。
be quick; be quick to react

entry.def: Jíé 捷 adds to the notion of maximum speed the nuance of deftness and general skill.

sense.def: rapidly; LH 1: at reasonably quick speed
to quicken, to become violent (like a gust of wind)

entry.def: Jí 疾 (ant. xú 徐 "slowly") typically refers to urgent speedy action of limited duration.

sense.def: those who are quick; the speedy
swiftly, quickly; rashly; in such haste
be fast and intensive (of wind etc)
move quickly; move with urgency; be fast enough
be very quick to, be very eager to

entry.def: Xùn 迅 emphasises high speed and abruptness and eruptive violence, often in natural processes.

sense.def: be extremely fast and strong (of winds or lightning); be quick to come
quickly; fast; as soon as possible
quickly ( e.g. 速能V= 能速V)
be speedy, rapid, quick; be in a hurry
speed up; hasten (a contextually determinate object or action)
cause to come quickly, quicken the arrival of, "invite"; speed up

entry.def: 1. The most current general word for anything that moves at high speed is sù 速 (ant. chí 遲 "so slowly that one becomes late").
Piāo 飄 refers specifically to the speed of wind.

sense.def: fleet, quick as if flying 飛駏

entry.def: Bù rì 不日without delay, in a short time, quickly.

sense.def: in a short time (like a day and its night), quickly
be quick to emerge, to change and to disappear; be ephemeral
be quick to emerge, to change and to disappear; be ephemeral; be fleeting past
quick and urgent musical mode; prestissimo
quick and urgent musical mode; prestissimo
be rapid, be quick to react
